website_summaries.verdict: The mouse pad to choose when you want a higher level of comfort and support.
pros: Large gel wrist pad is contoured around the proper angle to keep the wrist supported during long periods of use
Gel support is smooth without being too squishy
cons: Main pad area is smaller compared to traditional pads

customer_reviews.title: I have had this exactly one month and the material ...
customer_reviews.text: The first one I had ---I have had this exactly one month and the material around the wrist pad has come apart from the base. It has been replaced by the company; they do read their reviews and try to make things right. And they have here --- I could tell right away that this one was a good product because the bottom is shiny and smooth. The first one I had, the bottom was wrinkled, so I believe it was a defect. I'm definitely now pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Misleading, inaccurate description.
customer_reviews.text: The description states that the mouse pad has a polyurethane (PU) bottom that will keep the product from sliding all over the desk. However, I received an email after receiving the mouse pad that said NOT to peel off the plastic backing as the SILICA GEL BACKING may damage furniture. That is NOT what was in the description. When I emailed the company notifying them that I did peel off the backing, they offered to send a new one. The customer service was great and very quick; however, I will not get a replacement as I don't think I can trust what is actually in this mouse pad.
customer_reviews.author: S. Minica

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse Pad - Super Comfortable! Definitely Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This mouse pad is super comfortable. The pad for the wrist has a lot of padding to it so your wrist will not hurt like how it would when it rests on the desk or table. This mouse pad has a great non slip bottom to ensure that the mouse pad will stay put while in use. The edges do seem to curl just a tad, not quite sure why. But I'd say that's the only thing wrong with this mouse pad. Overall this is a nice mouse pad and does it's job. I would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Hier

customer_reviews.title: Well designed, quality mousepad UPDATED
customer_reviews.text: Update: The seller just contacted me to warn me that if I remove the protective film from the bottom of the mousepad, the "non-slip PU" base may damage my desk. They waited about a week to tell me that, the film is long gone. They suggest I put a piece of paper between the mousepad and my desk to prevent damage to the finish. Unbelievable. In the trash it goes. It tracks a little slowly for gaming, but it's smooth enough and seems to be well made. The design is pretty close to the natural way my wrist works. It misses the fifth star because the gel for the wrist-rest is very firm and not as comfortable as some others.
customer_reviews.author: TGR

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: This mousepad smelled horrid. As soon as I opened the ultra cheap plastic wrap, the smell "burned" my nostrils and stayed with me for awhile. The bottom rubber also looked funny. I set it aside for a few days and then tried to use it. The smell made me light headed... I think it may have been toxic. I threw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Van Gogh

customer_reviews.title: This is not happening
customer_reviews.text: This item came as delivered. However it is not for me. First the wrist rest is too high though I'm sure that this a personal choice. It comes with a plastic seal on the bottom. Do not remove this. I was not prepared to use so I was lucky that I did not remove. Received e-mail next day advising me not to remove the plastic shield covering the back as it will DAMAGE desk top. I should also note that this plastic shield is poorly applied. There are many wrinkles and it makes a crinkling noise when in use. Not worth the hassle to return and I do not wish for another.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: Problems are a sticky bottom which makes it hard to adjust the placement of the pad and the wrist pad which makes moving how I hold the mouse difficult. I prefer a simple pad where my wrist can adjust to the position of my body to the desk which is constantly changing. This pad is trying to hold me in one place and diminishes the possibility of movement.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Radheshwar

customer_reviews.title: same exact thing happened.  Sticky black goo seeped out all over my desk.
customer_reviews.text: This lasted for 8 months, then fell apart on the bottom of the wrist rest. Seeped out greasy, sticky, black gel all over my desk. It was fine while it lasted, but I wouldn't recommend you buy this one. UPDATE: The seller sent me a new one and so far it’s working well. It was nice that they sent a new one. I have changed my rating as a result. However we’ll see what happens. It’s only been a few days. UPDATE!!! The new one they sent did the same thing, greasy black gel all over. I was happy I got a new one, but same thing all over again.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Lesko

customer_reviews.title: VERY COMFORTABLE! but has flaws....
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse pads! after a few weeks of braking in it conforms to your wrist and becomes a very comfortable supportive cradle, have not had any wrist trouble since i got this. Unfortunately after some months of use it tore/became unglued at the seam and now sticky slimy stuff is coming out. it started off as just a small separation and I could live with it but now it is getting to the point of the sticky stuff coming out and making my wrist sticky. I want to try and get another one though, hopefully some of the design issues have gotten figured out, I just love the way it supports my wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Martina S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellant customer service with a truely inferior product.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE 3RD POST: VicDirect replaced the defective mouse pad AND the replacement pad is coming unglued just like the first one. It's not acceptable, doesn't last. Would not recommend this pad for more than 3 months life then the trash can. UPDATE: 2nd Post: Excellant customer service, I didn't ask for replacement, but they sent one. It was a no hassle replacement of the pad many months after purchase. 1st Post: Cover material separating from edge of the silicone base. I'll try some kind of glue I guess. My last pad lasted 5 years, so 6 months on this one is disappointing, perhaps a few more $'s on a replacement is an answer. This pad:
customer_reviews.author: Doc Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Stays clean
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty sturdy mousepad. Underneath the mousepad is a shiny plastic which "sticks" to the table without actually being sticky. This prevents the mousepad from sliding or gathering dust and debris underneath. After several months of using this, the underside is still clean and the mousepad never slid once. The fabric on the top of the mousepad can be easily wiped clean. The wrist rest is quite comfortable once you get used to it. The edge of my wrist no longer gets red since using this.
customer_reviews.author: Yura

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Logitech wireless mouse doesn't pick up on the dark flat part of the pad, and when I cut the flat part off (bc the wrist pad is curved on the side close to you) the wrist pad would slide around. I used it a few times as an elbow rest and the gel is crushed beyond use and does not spring back.
customer_reviews.author: NicoleB

customer_reviews.title: Starts disintegrating almost from the start.
customer_reviews.text: Buy the hard, shiny type of mouse pad. This one with it's textured type surface became like a cotton ball showing white wear spots within a week of using it. I am not a gamer, don't even use the computer that much. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Does the job and lasts
customer_reviews.text: After nearly two and a half years of daily use at work, 8+ hours a day, this is what it looks like. I'd say I got my money's worth! The wrist pad is very comfortable and I've never experienced any pain from prolonged use, which means it works. The material is adequate. Only negative is that it had deformed over time, bubbling up in the center and lifting at the edges. Nothing lasts forever but this has done a good job. Time to get another one.
customer_reviews.author: Darkmatter661

customer_reviews.title: A good mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new mouse pad and this seemed like a good fit. Some of the reviews noted that the wrist mound may give way over time (mine hasn't done this yet) and that it may come with a strong plastic smell that you need to air out, which is very possible when it comes to mouse pads. I had another mouse pad ordered from a different seller and it had such a grossly strong smell that it immediately gave me a headache and made me feel sick, which no product I have ever ordered has done before. Overall this is a good mouse pad for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality, Tall Wrist Rest
customer_reviews.text: This mouspad is of stellar quality. The gripped side works really well on glass, wood, and granite. The only downside is the cushioned wrist rest is slightly too tall for someone with very small hands and arms. I have to rest my forearm on it instead of my wrist in order to be able to actually use my mouse, which is not too big of a deal for me but might be for others. Overall, this was an excellent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: It lasted one month...
customer_reviews.text: I loved this product but then I started noticing the gel was coming apart and it was a big mess in the end where it was unbearable to use. It lasted a month and then it turned to some disembodied monster, decaying over the last week. I do believe in second chances, and maybe the product I got was just no good. I ended up getting it replaced and so far so good, it's only been a week but I'll definitely update my review at the end of the month. If all is well then you will definitely be seeing a 5 star from me and I will be purchasing 15 for my class.
customer_reviews.author: Ale

customer_reviews.title: Significantly reduces wrist strain
customer_reviews.text: The VicTsing pad teplaced my old wrist pad which had started to curl and had lost the ability for the mouse to glide. The gel foam on this pad provides good cushioning for the wrist. The mouse moves effortlessly across the pad. There was no odor. I did not remove the plastic on the bottom as per instructions. I do find it strange that the instructions say that removing the plastic may damage the furniture. The thin wrinkly plastic will eventually come off on it's own. The manufacturer should have designed the pad to have a good base.
customer_reviews.author: WorldHiker

customer_reviews.title: Comfy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two...one for my work-from-home husband, and one for my 14yr old gaming son. Neither of them had complained about wrist pain with their old mouse pads (without support), but since I have carpal tunnel, I know that the discomfort and pain can build up over time. Both of my guys say these mouse pads are comfy. My son especially likes his. I do wish that I had known not to take the film off the bottom, though. If that was written anywhere, I definitely missed it!
customer_reviews.author: CJM

customer_reviews.title: Glad I purchased this!  Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I was having some problems with my write hurting while working on the computer and decided to seek out a new mouse pad. I found this on Amazon and the reviews seemed to be good so I decided to give it a try. So far, so GREAT! I love it, feels great and I have much less fatigue in my write. It did not really take me long to adjust to the new mouse pad. I would highly recommend (also, I just got an email today that stated the mouse pad comes with an 18-month warranty, now that is a great warranty!).
customer_reviews.author: theartigasfamily

customer_reviews.title: Great ergonomics, Tracking on the new model non ergonomic VicTsing is better.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice mouse pad and design. The edges are lightly "crimped" giving it a more finished appearance and less chance for edge fraying. The gel is in the right place and is comfortable. This pad is as good if not better than more expensive varieties with touted 3M reflective coating. My only negative is that the newer VicTsing full size pads have a better coating and better tracking. Don't get me wrong, the tracking is very good, but the newer model is better. But,t hey don't make the newer surface in the Gel Wrist model. This full size model has better tracking.
customer_reviews.author: HomerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: "good enough" product at a good price
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't say these are an amazing mouse pad, but they seemed great for the price, and I don't have any issues with my wrists, despite using my computer for work and for play probably 10-12 hours a day. I got one for each hand, so I can switch sides of the keyboard throughout the day to give my hands a rest, but I don't have to clear a space each time and move the pad back and forth. I have a mouse on each side too, which makes a big difference in ease of using my computer, but at a very low cost.
customer_reviews.author: CaptainBlackton

customer_reviews.title: Great pad for price
customer_reviews.text: I got a lap board to use a wireless keyboard and mouse. My wrist began to get sore. I researched and found this. Love it. Sticks to the board so well I can stand the board vertically and it doesn't move, but if I need to reposition it is easy to pick up and place where I want. It didn't smell at all like some of the reviews said, and my GF can smell what the neighbors are cooking lol. It is sturdy and comfortable and no flaws in fabric or weak points I could find.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Works great, shows dirt rather easily
customer_reviews.text: Ergonomically, this thing is a dream and I love it. It gets daily use at my desk job where I use the computer and mouse extensively. My only complaint is that it gets grubby looking faster than I’d expect. I keep my work station very well dusted, I don’t use a lot of lotion on my skin or eat near my computer, etc. so I’m not entirely sure why this mousepad started looking “lived in” so quickly. The gel also shifted a little bit and now it’s kinda lumpy. It’s so affordable though so I’ll probably just buy another. All in all, I’d say it’s a good product.
customer_reviews.author: SavJay

customer_reviews.title: Enjoying this mouse pad; Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Admittedly, I received a defective product at first, but VicTsing was able to quickly replace it at no cost! I really do enjoy this ergonomic mouse pad! The cushion is a perfect overall size for my wrist to rest comfortably. And the pad size is sufficient for even the most energetic of mouse-handlers. Thank you VicTsing for your great customer service. I appreciated you reaching out. Looking forward to buying more products from you in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Larsh

customer_reviews.title: Stays in place, Mouse gets good traction, Wrist is comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I already had a mouse pad with a gel wrist rest of another brand. The top cover on my old mouse pad had a bizzare ability to attract dust and dog hair like I had never seen before. Every 3 days I had to clean it using sticky tape to remove all this. This material does not share this tendency, it stays nice and clean. The VicTsing mouse pad does not have as large a wrist rest, but my wrist doesn't travel much these days. I use a mouse/pointing device with a track ball so the mouse stays in one place. So does the mouse pad on my desk - another difference that I like.
customer_reviews.author: AnnieInAcworth

customer_reviews.title: No frills mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: I use this mouse pad for general non gaming use, i imagine for gaming you would want something larger but i like this size as it doesn't take up a lot of space. The mouse pad material is soft but i find it hard to clean, this is not restricted to this mouse pad alone though. I have no problems with tracking with a logitech master mx. The only downside for me is the gel pad is too hard in my opinion, i would prefer something softer and/or a bit higher though it is much better than not having a wrist rest at all. Overall good product.
customer_reviews.author: M dot.Ace

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is my second VicTsing Ergonomic Mouse Pad with Gel Wrist Rest Support. The previous one lasted exactly 19 month before it started leaking gel from the wrist rest. In all fairness, I used that mouse pad 7 days a week at least 10 hours a day, and I am a little heavy handed. For the price I certainly cannot complain about the product, and if this replacement last just as long, I will be happy. I won't hesitate to buy another one in the future. It is very comfortable and keeps your wrist and forearm in proper ergonomic position.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: NO MORE PAIN!
customer_reviews.text: I am a heavy gamer and I also happen to do a little bit of work on my computer. I hadn't needed a wrist pad for years but I picked up a shooter game that made my carpal tunnel flare up immediately. A friend suggested I get a wrist pad for my mouse hand and suddenly the pain is gone. It takes a while to get used to if you aren't used to having the pad there though. I'm so glad there's a sticky surface on the bottom because it was moving around a lot without it. I did clean the surface before sticking the mouse pad on. Definitely recommend this product if you're having problems with wrist pain.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart after a few months.
customer_reviews.text: Update: So after a few months this thing is falling apart (see pics). The soft “gel” is oozing out and gets all over everything and leaves a nasty residue. Choose a different pad. Comfort and size are great. Perfect if you never have to move your mouse pad. This thing STICKS to my desk. I have to peel it up every time I need to move it. Wish it wasn’t so hard to move... it’s like a peel and stick window cling.
customer_reviews.author: Bosun Rob

customer_reviews.title: Worked well initially
customer_reviews.text: This worked well when I first got it, and the price was right. Over time, however, the wrist 'lump' started to compact and become hard, thereby causing my wrist to ache in the exact place that it connected with the lump. I have just ordered a Fellowes, which I have had in the past but was much more expensive, but my experience with it was that it never lost it's comfort.
customer_reviews.author: GDB

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, mouse tracks well
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice mouse pad. The wrist pad is adequate but inobtrusive. Soft enough with a firm base. All of my mice track very well on it. It is comfortable to my hand. It stays put. It is as big as I would want and gives a pretty decent workspace. Hasn't frayed or worn yet and looks OK. The print isn't as attractive as it looks in the picture but it is fine.
customer_reviews.author: ImMrBill3

customer_reviews.title: 4 months and ripping at seams
customer_reviews.text: I like how this feels and for the price point... but i've had it four months and it's ripping at the seams and the gel is showing. I use it in my home office and i don't think i overused it or abuse it in any way. i just wish it lasted a little longer than four months. I'm conflicted whether i'm just going to buy it again or i'm going to go with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Yervant D. Ekmekji

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomic wrist rest for computer mouse is shiny like red constellations in sky!
customer_reviews.text: I am definitely not a gamer! But I bought this because my wrist hurt from the wrong angle. This is not only great gel-filled, but the photo in the ad is not even fair to the actual product. It looks like shiny red constellations, and in person it is even slicker! Rounded pad on the user's end means no sharp corners on your wrist. GREAT Idea, perfectly executed and FUN to use, instead of dreary ordinary mousepads.
customer_reviews.author: RealNews

customer_reviews.title: The bottom of the mouse pad has a grip surface so it doesn't slide around
customer_reviews.text: I like this mouse mad. The bottom grip was a pleasant surprise as I hadn't actually read anything on this product about it's features. It looks good, it's grippy on the bottom, and it's got the wrist rest. I'm pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Parks

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: I love the mouse pad because it has great support for my wrist. The only reason I didn't give it a perfect score was the back of the pad had plastic on it so it can be secured to the table, I suppose, but I didn't want to remove it because I was afraid it would ruin my desk and also I wouldn't be able to move it around. I would have liked one that didn't have the adhesive on the back.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Bader

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: It's nice but it's a little bit big for my workspace. And I do see that he's a pain the back but I'm never going to use that show it would have been nice just to have a rubber grip on the bottom so that I didn't have to permanently put it on my desk. I didn't remove the plastic so that never happened. So it's lights around when using it because of that, but as far as comfort my wrist feels much better and that's the reason why I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Hadrina T.

customer_reviews.title: Rough fabric that quickly fades
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this product for a few months now and I went back to my Belkin WaveRest. The material on this product did not feel smooth as I anticipated, but instead felt a bit rough and scratchy. Instead of a smooth experience moving my mouse and wrist, both seems to get caught on the material. The wrist support is quickly fading away on me and is nearly white now. The mouse pad does it job, but not as well as it should.
customer_reviews.author: JavaDragon

customer_reviews.title: Lasted only 9 months
customer_reviews.text: The pad is very comfortable and i bought a second on 6 months ago, however the first one after only 9 months has split apart were it attaches to the bottom and gel is leaking out. I believe it should last more than a year. I could not find any way to contact the seller to see if it has any guarantee so here is my Buyer Beware comment.
customer_reviews.author: Jon hinds

customer_reviews.title: Good customer service
customer_reviews.text: Update to the original review which stated, "After just a few weeks of use, pad has lost the tacky finish on the back so that it now slips around on the desktop a little too easily. Pad rest is a little small and on the hard side which makes it less comfortable than I would like." Vendor sent a replacement mouse pad in response to the original review and the new pad is sticking to my desktop and performing as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Bill T.

customer_reviews.title: Love how it doesn't move on my desk!
customer_reviews.text: The non-slide bottom is great; just make sure you position it right on your desk. Love the firmness of the ergonomic features, and I really appreciate the product quality. Thank you! Well worth the purchase ...
customer_reviews.author: Solnichka Frankenstein

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have used the same Hello Kitty mouse pad for over seven years, so I was not too keen on buying another. My husband made me, and my Hello Kitty was falling apart and looked dreadful. I picked this one out because of the price and the similarity of design to my old one. It feels similar except it is not as rigid as my old one, and the bottom slides around which is very annoying. I used some double sided tape to fix it but I feel this is a design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Anayrb

customer_reviews.title: As advertised - Good Quality Pad at a Good Price
customer_reviews.text: Seems well built, good firm wrist support. Sticks to the desktop (glass top) like glue - doesn't budge! Can't say it's REMARKABLE, but then I'm not sure what "remarkable" would be in a mouse pad. This is what I wanted and expected - solid, good quality and unobtrusive. We'll see about durability when I've used it for a while, but I have no concerns.
customer_reviews.author: ElJoey

customer_reviews.title: Fell Apart After 2 Months of Use
customer_reviews.text: Awful quality. DO NOT BUY. UPDATE: After complaining of the quality Amazon refunded me in full. I ended up purchasing another and the quality is much better. I must have received a defective batch. This is a 4 star fair value mouse pad. There are better ones out there and there are worse ones out there. The bonus with this one is a very firm palm rest.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Fenner

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and affordable
customer_reviews.text: My work and entertainment generally has me sitting around my desk for most of the day. For me it's very important to have a comfortable setup to minimize the strain that long hours can do to your body. That's why when I saw this mouse pad, it was a no brainer that I had to try it out. I've been using it for a little while now, and it's surprisingly comfortable, has a nice, large surface for my mouse to move around on, and is overall a great purchase for the price. I'll be observing its longevity over time and will update if needed. For now, 5/5 for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Keno C.

customer_reviews.title: At first I thought I made a mistake, but I did not.
customer_reviews.text: I needed to rest my wrist, and it was there so I used it, and I have been using ever since. When I first tried it, I wasn't so impressed, but this particular evening, after everything was done, I sat down on my computer and started to reach for the mouse, when my wrist felt heavy. I immediately reached for VicTsing mouse pad, and it did not disappoint. I have been using it every since.
customer_reviews.author: Angela M. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Surface doesn't work with optical mouse.
customer_reviews.text: This is absurd. The surface is such that a regular Logitech optical mouse doesn't work. I'm back to using the back of a magazine cover. How could VicTsing not know this?
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Vosburgh

customer_reviews.title: started having some pain in my right wrist area.
customer_reviews.text: my son told me i needed some sort of mousepad that had wrist support. the shape of this one is not only very cool, it is ergonomically perfect. also I got the red instead of black, i thought that maybe that was a mistake,but, the red is dark and fades to black with brighter spots in it, it looks great without being garish, not some huge red neon eyesore but very neat and professional.
customer_reviews.author: redfearn teal

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse pad to save your wrist
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace an old flat mouse pad I've had forever. Now that we have been working from home for a while I can feel my wrist getting sore after so many hours at the computer. This mouse pad helps keep everything in line and has a perfect amount of tension in the wrist pad. Bottom of the pad is very sticky so it's not moving around at all either.
customer_reviews.author: xswimguy

customer_reviews.title: This is a great mousepad!
customer_reviews.text: If you need a rounder mousepad to allow more natural movement of your mouse; if you need a wrist rest that supports and doesn't cause tired wrist after hours, if you need a good looking mousepad that does those things, buy this one. It is cushiony, fashionable, and best of all has NO, really NO, chemical/production odor.
customer_reviews.author: C Jones

customer_reviews.title: Non-slip base.  Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: The mouse pad is of pretty good quality and has a non-stick base. Be sure to peel off the plastic covering upon arrival. As others have stated, the wrist wrest is a little firm but not bad. The actual surface of the mouse pad is a bit more course than other plastic/fabric mouse pads I have had for the last 30 years. After taking some time to get used to it, this isn't an issue. With time, I assume it will get smoother as the mouse pad is worn down. Over all, a good mouse pad and great for the price. It seems to be more difficult finding a good mouse pad with a wrist rest these days.
customer_reviews.author: jmbly

customer_reviews.title: comfortable and ergonomic.  And "pretty"
customer_reviews.text: I don't write reviews often but I needed a mouse pad for support of my wrist and pressure on my hand. Not only is this a very pretty mouse pad (I love the colors) BUT it is super comfortable and the soft pad for my hand made this super comfortable. I love this and would highly recommend for those of you sitting at your computer for hours on end.
customer_reviews.author: Lori  C

customer_reviews.title: The gel area is not soft enough for me
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the mouse pad for about 6 weeks now and although it is good quality and a nice size, it hasn't worked out for me. The gel area has very little give and doesn't give the comfort I need for hours at the computer. By the end of the day, the heel of my hand and wrist are red and uncomfortable and now I'm starting to have pain in my shoulder from trying to adjust my arm to get comfortable. I need to find an option that has a much softer gel cushion. The give on this one is minimal.
customer_reviews.author: 2RidePegasus

customer_reviews.title: A bit smaller than ideal
customer_reviews.text: With all the craziness happening in a world we needed to start working more from home so figured this mousepad would be better for the wrist since we have something similar in the office. It does feel good against the skin but sometimes I find myself falling off the pad. For reference we use the Logitech performance mouse MX
customer_reviews.author: KEVIN YIP

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I had another VicTsing mouse pad before this one. It was not ergomonic but well made. So it was not hard choosing this one over the others offered. It is comfortable. On my glass top desk, it stays in place. I also liked the shape of it. Even though I read about the odor from the reviews, I didn't notice an odor unless I placed it up to my nose. I will continue to buy my mouse pads from VicTsing. Great quality, great price.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle T.

customer_reviews.title: Works swell!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned similar pads to this one, but my recent pads did not have the smooth bottom surface that sticks to the desktop like this one (I prefer this, easy to clean and get it to stick again. Not adhesive just smooth ). I was concerned that the Gel portion (wrist rest) would not be wide enough but I have been using it a few days now and it is very adequate. Maybe add some dimensional information to the Amazon listing? Gel portion is approximately 4-7/8" x 2-3/8". I am ordering another one to put on the shelf for when this one wears out.
customer_reviews.author: D. C.

customer_reviews.title: Surprised at quality for price! Nicely manufactured.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this mousepad may be a bit thin or on the cheap side when purchasing because of the price. However after checking the reviews I decided to give it a shot, I was shocked at how well made it was. Thicker than expected and better quality too. Perfect for my work office desk. I don't even use the adhesive back to stick to my desk because it really doesn't slide much at all, although I do like that it is an option in case I should need to more permanently attach it. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Autumn Birch

customer_reviews.title: Not Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: this mouse pad is painful to use. the support is hard and and high enough to support my wrist. This pad replaced a Belkin pad that I had for years that was very comfortable but eventually wore out. Couldn't find the same Belkin, so bought this based on customer reviews -- all I can say is that it is painful on my wrist after using for 30-45 minutes. I've placed a small towel on top of the wrist pad to increase height. I'm in market for another mouse pad.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Debacker

customer_reviews.title: Mouse won’t track on mousepad
customer_reviews.text: I like the style and ergonomics of the mousepad but my mouse was not tracking well on it. My mouse is a standard HP usb plug in mouse. I suspect it had trouble with the material of the mouse pad but not sure. The mouse tracks perfectly fine on my desk but now I’m back to no wrist support. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this months ago but with all that’s been going on in the world I figured I’d write a review. Due to COVID-19, I have been working from home and have really gotten a chance to utilize this mousepad. It is amazingly comfortable; the wrist pad is perfect and makes working in front of the computer for hours a more comfortable experience. It’s also perfect for gamers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good price for just the right amount of wrist support
customer_reviews.text: I like that it is flexible and can go in my to-go bag with my wireless mouse and laptop. A little on the heavy side being gel for carrying around but makes using the coffee shop as an office a whole lot more enjoyable. Mouse tracking works well on the pad unlike some that have surfaces that throw off the optical sensor.
customer_reviews.author: always curious

customer_reviews.title: Not Good
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these for two computers and have finally thrown them away. The gel wrist rest support is very hard and not at all comfortable. Also the underside of the pad sticks to whatever surface and you cannot move it around without pulling it up. It's like glue almost.
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Mousepad For The Price, If You Don't Mind Replacing Every Six Months Or So
customer_reviews.text: This mousepad lasted about six months with daily use before the gel padding collapsed at the main point of wrist contact. However, for the price it works out to a little over $1/month and for that price I am happy with the product - and have now ordered a second one to replace the original. Design wise, it works quite well - the bottom stays put on the glass table, the padding (prior to collapse) has sufficient height to keep my wrist level, and the pad itself is sized well for mousing. As an FYI, I am using a wireless Magic Mouse which tracks well on this pad (it has trouble on some types of other pads).
customer_reviews.author: Mersey Swift

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for the Money
customer_reviews.text: I've only had it a couple of days. The back is slightly sticky, in a good way, as it keeps the pad from sliding around on the desk. So far, I am enjoying using it. Some of the ergonomic pads I've used are too tall and hard to be comfortable. This one so far has been very comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.author: Guy C

customer_reviews.title: Have a Son-shine day!
customer_reviews.text: This mouse pad is great with everything except the reason I ordered it. It's nonslip, comfortable and the mouse glides over the surface. However, for some reason, the cursor rarely moves. I don't know what the problem is, but I ordered another pad from another company. It's probably user error, but I can't figure out what the problem is.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi

customer_reviews.title: very comfortable, worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: this is my first ergonomic mousepad and i might say the best i've EVER worked with! it stays in one spot, no need to constantly adjust anymore! and the wrist guard is a very nice plus, as it adds to the comfort of being able to play games and work on projects on my pc. it's perfect for my desk, as it fits right where i need it to. very good comfort for the money!
customer_reviews.author: gamefreak36

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction, great deal for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Non-slip material on holds the mouse pad firmly in place while using. I have a glass top desk, perfect for it and doesn't leave a mark on the desk either. The raised part that supports the wrist is slightly cushioned, but doesn't give much when your wrist is resting on it. Solid construction, I use it daily while I work from home Mon - Fri and haven't noticed any breakdown. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable mouse pad, just don't remove the plastic film on the bottom.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse pad for my mom who uses the computer for light web browsing and she loves it! She has some joint pain in her wrists so this gel wrist pad lets her be more comfortable in front of the computer. The only thing I would advise which VicTsing also mentioned but didn't really emphasize is to just leave the bottom plastic film on the mouse pad. If you take it off, there are some strong odors that can come out which may bother some people. For me it is fine, but for my mom the smell could be a bit strong. Just leave it on and you will be set!
customer_reviews.author: M. Weng

customer_reviews.title: I had another one like this that I liked much better as far as comfort ...
customer_reviews.text: I had another one like this that I liked much better - the old one (different brand/company) leaked after a couple years, so I had to throw away, so I decided not to buy another one of those. This one, the wrist lift is smaller and much harder. Will probably not leak, but doesn't feel nearly as good as the softer one did. Does raise the wrist, and probably does what it's supposed to do, but you feel it, and the other one you didn't notice. It is well made and will last
customer_reviews.author: Stace23

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse Pad
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty much the perfect replacement to the Innovera ones I have used for years that always end up pilling. The Lycra type covering is much better for tracking/durability and the wrist support and shape make it very comfortable to use. I can't go back to no wrist support after having used these. And the shape is efficient. I tried to use it on a soft bed and there are some tracking issues but that is to be expected on a pillowy surface.
customer_reviews.author: trombone

customer_reviews.title: Curled edges
customer_reviews.text: I received it today and noticed the edges are curled up. The curl doesn't seem to be getting less as it has been sitting on my desk. Is this a defect or is it supposed to be this way? If it supposed to be this way then this product surely gets 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: straightforward

customer_reviews.title: Very good mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one to replace a nearly identical mousepad I had made by Curtis. Overall, the construction of the Curtis pad seemed more durable and substantial, but this pad is very good and has an equally good wrist support. The non-slip grip on the bottom of this pad is second to none.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony M.

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable mousepad
customer_reviews.text: I have happily used this mousepad for 15 months now. I even bought a 2nd for work. The only reason this doesn't get 5 stars is because after 15 months, the fabric covering the wrist pad has split open and the sticky gel has squeezed out. Even so, I'm buying another one of these to replace it. It's that comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Schaeflein

customer_reviews.title: Great comfort and wrist support.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a mouse pad and decided to go with one that had the wrist support. This one is really great, not too squishy and not too hard. Perfect amount of plush for my wrist. I am just using this for normal computer usage (currently online teaching and learning).
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla Andrade

customer_reviews.title: NOT a pad you want to game with!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pad to replace an old one that wore out. I use these for gaming (even though this might surprise you) and this one turned out with one flaw. For some reason, when I try to flick back and forth, I sometimes end up with half of what I try to do and end up looking at the sky. Not a bad mouse pad for regular stuff. It’s very comfortable but I wouldn’t recommend it for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos (CDC Bro)

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with my purchase. I only have one suggestion. Include the comment in the instructions to keep the plastic film on the bottom of the pad to prevent damage to your desk. I removed the film and the pad sticks to my desk, making it difficult to move the pad when needed. It has not caused damaged to my glass top desk. Therefore, I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: Guera

customer_reviews.title: As expected, vibrant coloring, smooth
customer_reviews.text: I feel that for the price this item is probably a better value than what I'd find for the same price in a store. I get a callous on my wrist under my pointy bone and this pad has helped reduce the stiffness of that spot. As expected the stress of using my mouse doesn't make my hand/wrist so sore
customer_reviews.author: ttbloodlusttt

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse pad!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this mouse pad. I removed the protective plastic from the bottom and the mouse pad doesn't slide at all. Some people have complained about an odor. If I place my nose just above the pad, I do smell an unpleasant odor. But I smell nothing while sitting up and using the pad. Some people's sense of smell is more acute than the average person's. If you are one of those people, then maybe you shouldn't buy this pad.
customer_reviews.author: R. Piper

customer_reviews.title: Large and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This mouse pad is larger than I thought it would be, which is good. My mouse doesn't slide off the edge. The pad has a strong grip which keeps if from sliding around, but it can still easily be moved if necessary. The mouse glides smoothly across the pad. The wrist rest is squishy and comfortable. My wrist stays supported so I'm happy with the overall value and quality of this mouse pad.
customer_reviews.author: LilMissMuffin

customer_reviews.title: Pad helps wrists
customer_reviews.text: The gel pad reduces wrist pains. The mouse responds well to this pad. Most of the pads I recently used, did not work well with my mice. The pad frequently slides around, so I have to rearrange it multiple times a day. I left the rear plastic on the pad. The manufacturer recommended to leave it on because the material the back is made of will adhere to the desk. I would rather it move around then be stuck in one spot.
customer_reviews.author: E. L. Brozovsky

customer_reviews.title: Good ergonomic help when using your computer in quarantine
customer_reviews.text: Many of us are using our computers even more during quarantine. I was starting to feel discomfort in my wrist and shoulder because of this. So, I bought this ergonomic mouse pad and it's already making a positive difference to my comfort level. (I'm not a gamer; I use my computer for work.)
customer_reviews.author: WDE

customer_reviews.title: So good I bought 2!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this exact one at work for a while now. Since I am mostly working from home I decided to buy one for there too. I really like that the palm rest is fairly firm, and still a little soft. Much better than the super soft gel ones.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Hofer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with my wireless mouse
customer_reviews.text: The mousepad itself is nice, comfortable to use. But, to get it to work with my wireless mouse, I have to put a small book between the mouse and the mousepad. Very disappointing since it is helpful in keeping my wrist comfy. For reference, this is the mouse that I am using (and I refuse to switch because I love it!)
customer_reviews.author: Jen L

customer_reviews.title: Is as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: The backing ensures it doesn't slip or move, the wrist support is right where it needs to be and the mouse moves over the pad area easily.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Bolter

customer_reviews.title: Not as soft as it claims....
customer_reviews.text: I have been using gel based wrist rests for at least 20 years. There are a lot of hard based gels, which I find uncomfortable. I purchased this one because it said it was soft and had a slow response. Not true. It was hard and returned to shape very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Edmond

customer_reviews.title: Superior design and good quality material for a really reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: I got the black and red color. The wrist rest really makes it comfortable when you spend hours playing games. Before I got this mouse pad I would have wrist pain after a whole night playing, but not anymore. It's visibly made of a good material that won't wear out anytime soon and I like it particularly because it sticks to my glass desk so it stays in place even when I'm intensely moving the mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Lanna Moreno

customer_reviews.title: Love this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mouse pad because I didn't have one, and I'm always working and doing things on my computer. I had been experiencing pain and discomfort for a while, so I looked for a mousepad like this with the soft cushion. It has helped me a lot already and it's only been 4 days. It's the perfect size, while holding your mouse in the center at a rest, you can move your wrist in either direction and still be on the pad.
customer_reviews.author: Valarie Stadnyk

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product. Say bye bye to wrist pain
customer_reviews.text: This is as comfortable a mouse pad as it can get. Since I started working from home, I developed a pretty intense wrist pain with the constant mouse use, so much so that I couldn't lift anything heavy. I ordered this over the weekend and started using it from Monday and my pain was gone by Thursday. The wrist support I feel is microfiber/gel probably and provides tremendous support to my wrist. Best of all the red pad compliments my mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Aisha Sultana

customer_reviews.title: Good for regular computer use, not gaming
customer_reviews.text: My daughter says it’s a bit difficult to use while playing Roblox because of the “bump” how she calls it. I think it’s a good mouse pad for regular computer use, with wrist support.
customer_reviews.author: The French Mom

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed LOW quality!
customer_reviews.text: Used for less than 8 hours, and the fabric that goes over the gel pad has already come off, i ordered a replacement, but I hope this was a one time error!
customer_reviews.author: warriorwebsiteservices

customer_reviews.title: Gel is too hard and narrow
customer_reviews.text: Gel is too hard and narrow. It creates a pressure point on the wrist. Not worth the hassle of returning. I'll just toss it in the trash. Update: Decided to go ahead and use this. Now, the edges are curling up. Junk. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Rigor Mortis

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: I started working from home and it has been on my own that I had to find good ergonomic office gear (if you will), and so I started with a good mouse pad. The one that I had is very old and didn't stay steady anymore. This one was absolutely perfect. It is soft and comfortable to set my wrist on. It had a warning about smell, but honestly I didn't notice anything. So far it's been great.
customer_reviews.author: Justly LaShay

customer_reviews.title: Relief for my wrist
customer_reviews.text: After working from home for the past 6mos due to COVID, my wrist was badly aching from overuse with the mouse on my wood desk. This gel pad has been great. As soon as I started using it, I felt immediate relief in my wrist and have not had any pain/fatigue since. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: AO

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to help with wrist pain. The pain was gone by the second day of use! It did take a little to adjust the first day but now it’s perfect. It’s got a grippy bottom too and doesn’t slide. To think this sat in my cart for week while I thought about it. Should have gotten it the day I saw it.
customer_reviews.author: HerMom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for everyday use
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my wife, who was having wrist pains. They have all but cleared up using this mousepad. The mousepad itself is not large, but since your wrist is resting on the gel support, it doesn't need to be. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott St. Amand

customer_reviews.title: so far, so good
customer_reviews.text: This is the most comfortable mouse pad I've ever owned. I've only had it for a short time, but it appears to be made of very strong material. If it's as sturdy as it looks, it'll be a great purchase. If not, I will update this, but so far, I could not be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Wrist support helps so much!
customer_reviews.text: I had been having pain in my wrist after using my mouse, and it was getting worse by the day, so I ordered this pad with wrist support and it made a big difference. I can use my computer longer without the debilitating pain now.
customer_reviews.author: VIP Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Firm yet comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great mouse pad so far! Be sure to remove the clear, plastic backing so that the pad can securely grip the surface. The "hump" where my wrist lays is firm yet comfortable. Love everything about it - great value for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne P.

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable, Too Hard
customer_reviews.text: The wrist pad has very little gel filling. There is a noticeable raised area under the gel pad. You can feel a hard raised lip of the pad molding. There is a thin pad of gel and the entire pad is covered in the same material. It looks nice and stays in place but that is about it for the good. I have a pad at work and one I travel with and quite aware of the difference in feel of this one.
customer_reviews.author: Scott K

customer_reviews.title: Tears up easily
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if it's the mouse I'm using or my fingernails catching on it or what, but the center of the mouse pad tore up very easily within a few days. I got the black and red, which looks to be a different material than the others. That being said, it is extremely comfortable and a good size.
customer_reviews.author: L.

product_meta.title: VicTsing Mouse Pad, Ergonomic Mouse Pad with Gel Wrist Rest Support, Gaming Mouse Pad with Lycra Cloth, Non-Slip PU Base for Computer, Laptop, Home, Office & Travel, Black
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackAre you still using flay mouse pad all day?
Is your waist feels a little tired or stiff sometimes?
Now it's time to give our comfortable mouse pad with wrist support a shot, you will see how amazingly it works.

Waist Saver
This is a definitely a good investment. This wrist rest mouse pad helps reduce wrist pain and release working pressure. It is a waist saver for office workers, especially those who do editing work.

Confortable and Healthy
The GEL pad is encased under the Lycra so it isn't sticky like some mouse pads. The bottom is rubbery so it doesn't skid on the desk. And the material is ROSH approved, it is environmental, non-toxic and safe to use.

Perfect Overall Shape
When using a mouse you move the mouse in an arc pattern. Then you will understand how smart this design is. This mouse pad is much better than square or rectangular ones. You would move off the pad with square mouse pads. And the rectangular one would add some unusable space.

Matches Any Decor
The plain classic look of this mouse pad matches any décor. Unlike some mouse pads with a huge ad or picture in the middle of the pad, our simple black pad matches any décor.

Specifications:
Wrist Filling Material: Gel
Type: Mouse Pad with Wrist Support/ Wrist Rest
Dimensions: 9.84”x 8.86”x 0.79”in (L*W*H)

Package Included:
Mouse Pad with Wrist Rest x 1
feature_bullets: COMFORTABLE GEL FILLING. The soft gel-filled cushion conforms to your wrist for maximum comfort and support. It reduces wrist irritation and wrist pain. Keeps your waist in a neutral position for ergonomic comfort.

SMOOTH FABRIC COVERING. The smooth Lycra covering improves tracking movements and creates consistent gliding. It allows the cursor to move around quickly without stability or cause pain or fatigue in your waist.
GRIPS DESKTOP FIRMLY. The soft non-skid PU base grips the desktop firmly. It keeps the mouse pad from sliding on the desktop. It will never move from your desktop until you peel it off.

EXCELLENT SHAPE AND SIZE. Designed with an optimal shape and size. You can move the mouse around easily and the pad shapes it well. Moreover, the reinforced edges prevent deformation and damage to long time use.
ENVIRONMENTAL MATERIAL. Made of environmental material with ROHS Certificate to ensure safety. It is environmental, non-toxic and safe to use.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars8,134 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
